summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing staffing and overtime challenges at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details absenteeism rates and specific overtime worked by staff, including two staff members assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), in the days leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: On August 9, 2019, 28 correctional officers at MCC New York did not report to work, necessitating 23 overtime occurrences.

Two staff members assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) worked overtime; Noel worked a double shift ending at 8am on August 9, and Thomas worked voluntary OT on morning watch (12am-8am) on multiple dates including August 9.
The document reveals chronic staffing shortages at MCC NY, with an overall staffing rate of 84.86% and 19 vacant officer positions at the time.
The email chain is dated August 12-13, 2019, which is immediately prior to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC NY on August 10, 2019.
